------------------------------------------------------------------

Pat is intended to be a lightweight cyclic pattern generator,
which runs on python3 or python2, with no additional dependencies,
and which runs substantially more quickly than the metasploit 
pattern_create.rb and pattern_offset.rb tools. It's entirely
portable, and runs well on both *nix and Windows systems, and
is the sort of thing you might take along with you on your
buffer overflow picnics. 

To generate a pattern of, say, 500 characters, run

$ ./pat.py 100

To find the offset in pat's pattern of the string 'm7Am', for
example, run

$ ./pat.py m7Am

Note that the string should be at least three characters long
for pat to return useful information.

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Example, and comparison with pattern_{create,offset}.rb:
-----------------------------------------------------------------

$ /opt/metasploit/tools/exploit/pattern_create.rb -l 1024


real	0m3.023s
user	0m2.610s
sys	0m0.340s

$ time ./pat.py 1024


real	0m0.069s
user	0m0.067s
sys	0m0.003s

$ time /opt/metasploit/tools/exploit/pattern_offset.rb -q m7Am
[*] Exact match at offset 382

real    0m3.154s
user    0m2.720s
sys     0m0.350s

$ time ./pat.py m7Am
382

real    0m0.049s
user    0m0.047s
sys     0m0.000s
